result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarred M Norton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Obtain and maintain employment. Obtain GED/HSED.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
Successfully complete a parenting class.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarred M Norton

records.addlTxt: for Commitment Time for Non Compliance with Probation/Parole Order signed and filed.  Court ordered 30 days commitment time.  rmm

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Dallet 
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ x ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Defendant Jarred M Norton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Jarred M Norton in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

 Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 07/24/2015.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Successfully complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-No controlled substances without a vaild prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment. 
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.


AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit for 60 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.


Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit and Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Jury trial date of 05/11/2015 vacated. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Jarred M Norton not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant would like to enter a plea.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
to Adjourn received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Pretrial Conference held.  On the State's motion, Court ordered 15CM701 and 15CM746 joinder for trial. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ashley B.; Erin N. or Robert P.

Defendant Jarred M Norton in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Jarred M Norton in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
